definitions.definition: To determine one's position relative to the surroundings ; to orient (oneself).
To arrange in order; to dispose or place (a body) so as to show its relation to other bodies, or the relation of its parts among themselves.
To position (something), to align relative to a given position.
examples: Try to orientate your students towards the science subjects.

definitions.definition: To move or turn toward the east; to veer from the north or south toward the east.

main_definition: ( UK , Ireland , Commonwealth , intransitive ) To face a given direction.
secondary_definitions: ( UK , Ireland , Commonwealth , reflexive ) To determine one's position relative to the surroundings ; to orient (oneself).
To arrange in order; to dispose or place (a body) so as to show its relation to other bodies, or the relation of its parts among themselves.
( UK , Ireland , Commonwealth , transitive ) To position (something), to align relative to a given position.
( archaic ) To move or turn toward the east; to veer from the north or south toward the east.
